image.altText: Parts of a regional highway that shows both sealed roads and washed away portions

props.synopsis: The real challenge for the outback community is beginning as floodwaters start to clear, with critical infrastructure showing signs of serious damage.

title.children: Long road to recovery for Innamincka as receding floodwaters expose damage

image.altText: An Adelaide Lightning player lays the ball up.

props.synopsis: The future of South Australia's women's basketball team is in limbo, with the Adelaide Lightning at loggerheads with the WNBL about the club's future in the national competition.

title.children: Adelaide Lightning in limbo amid stand-off with WNBL

image.altText: a brick building with a Lochert Bros sign and a car parked out the front

props.synopsis: A Riverland West company has been fined $129,000 and convicted on two Work Health and Safety Act counts following a serious degloving incident of a 22-year-old worker.

title.children: Citrus packer fined $129k after 22yo worker degloved by machine

image.altText: A woman stands outside coroners court with a photo of her daughter

props.synopsis: The mother of a woman killed randomly by a man who previously experienced "homicidal ideation" has said the "incompetence" of the mental health system contributed to her death.

title.children: Victim's mum says killer 'slipped through the cracks' of system

image.altText: A man near a shark in shallow water.

props.synopsis: A shark has been returned to the ocean after it became stuck in shallow waters off a South Australian beach.

title.children: Trio free shark stuck in shallow waters

image.altText: a speed sign and a turnoff on a road with a car approaching in the distance

props.synopsis: Residents near major South Australian highways say roads are "not up to scratch" with "bandaid" repair jobs amid proposed changes to federal infrastructure funding that could see the state receive less.

title.children: Anger over highway 'patch jobs' amid less federal cash for SA roads

image.altText: Water splashing into a hand under a water tap. Water tank in the background.

props.synopsis: With many rainwater tanks across the Adelaide Hills running low or on empty due to an ongoing dry spell, two residents say thieves have used water trucks to steal nearly 200,000 litres overnight.

title.children: Nearly 200,000 litres of water stolen from Adelaide Hills tanks, residents say

image.altText: The remains of a large puffed up globe fish sit on the sand of a surf beach.

props.synopsis: As sharks, rays, and other marine life continue to wash up on South Australian beaches, citizen scientists are urged to record the scale of the lingering marine algal bloom event.

title.children: Citizen scientists needed to help sea life amid algal bloom devastation

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair wearing a black dress stands in a hair salon.

props.synopsis: Small businesses in parts of regional South Australia are feeling the pinch, as farmers and their families tighten their belts amid record-low rainfall.

title.children: Record dry hurting small businesses in country SA

image.altText: Bianca Feher sings into a microphone and plays her guitar wearing a green shirt. Tin sheets and bush are behind her.

props.synopsis: South Australia and New South Wales have introduced grassroots music programs to revitalise a struggling regional live music industry, and new research backs their initiatives.

title.children: Live music programs giving regional artists something to sing about

image.altText: Four people walking amongst streets with new builds behind them

props.synopsis: As Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton prepare for a sprint to the election finish line, some South Australians could be questioning if their state is part of the race.

title.children: Does South Australia matter this federal election?

image.altText: A man stands with his arms crossed in front of a house next to an empty lot.

props.synopsis: The major parties have decided on a solution to Australia's housing crisis: build more homes. But some of the country's newest suburbs suggest it's not as straightforward as it seems.

title.children: 'What I feel is left out': The growing pains of Australia's newest suburbs

image.altText: Scott de Bruin holding a large tomahawk wagyu cut.

props.synopsis: Australia's wagyu beef industry is poised for export growth amid America's falling beef herd numbers and continued demand for Australia's premium meat in global markets.

title.children: Wagyu beef producer confident about exports despite Trump tariff threat

image.altText: A black and white dairy cow looks up from its trough of feed

props.synopsis: The South Australian government provides $3 million in support for dairy farmers affected by the collapse of Beston Global Food.

title.children: $3m lifeline for dairy farmers out of pocket as processor liquidated

image.altText: ABC election analyst Antony Green Election

props.synopsis: The ABC's election guru reflects on the past 36 years at the national broadcaster in the final days before covering his last big poll on-air.

title.children: Antony Green on his most stressful election, proudest prediction and fight against unwieldy ballot papers

image.altText: Political candidates clapping in front of a crowd.

props.synopsis: The Greens have outlined an extensive policy wishlist in the hope they will wield the balance of power in a Labor minority government. So what are their key priorities?

title.children: Here's what the Greens will prioritise in a minority Labor government

image.altText: Purple sign reads "voting centre"

props.synopsis: Applications for postal votes close tonight at 6pm but early voters are wasting no time having their say.

title.children: More than 4 million Australians have already voted. Major political parties take note

image.altText: images of Jacinta Nampijinpa Price and Malarndirri McCarthy in front of an Aboriginal flag

props.synopsis: Indigenous leaders say they "despair" that culture wars and "nasty narratives" have trumped ambitious policy in the campaign's final stretch.

title.children: 'Dog whistling' and 'broken promises': Groundhog Day for Indigenous policy

image.altText: Donald Trump smiles as a crowd holds supportive signs behind him.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has used a campaign-style public rally to rage against "fake polls" that show his approval ratings falling as he chalks up 100 days back in office.

title.children: 'Non-stop nightmare': Away from Trump's cheery rally, Americans voice fears

image.altText: Heavy machinery demolishing a partially damaged house as men watch on.

props.synopsis: The Myanmar military has been accused of hoarding life-saving relief while survivors endure soaring heat, disease, and displacement in earthquake-shattered Myanmar.

title.children: One month after huge quake, Myanmar faces double crisis

image.altText: police officers in sweden walk around a crime scene and police tape blocks it off

props.synopsis: Three males aged between 15 and 20 were shot and killed in a hair salon in the Swedish city of Uppsala on Tuesday local time.

title.children: Teenager arrested on suspicion of murder after triple shooting in Sweden

image.altText: An older man wearing a suit sits at a panel with an older woman with a suit

props.synopsis: Malcolm Turnbull has taken aim at both US President Donald Trump and Australia's major political parties at the final Your Say panel, hosted on Wednesday.

title.children: Former prime minister fires at Trump, Australia's major parties

image.altText: Vaibhav Suryavanshi wears a helmet on his head

props.synopsis: Vaibhav Suryavanshi announces himself as a global megastar with an astounding century in the IPL at just 14. Here is why his astonishing achievement has been met with raised eyebrows by some.

title.children: This 14yo is shattering cricket's 'youngest ever' records — why is it causing controversy?

image.altText: Kane Cornes

props.synopsis: The Kangaroos confirm they have banned Channel 7 pundit Kane Cornes from talking to players and coaches over "vindictive attacks" aimed at North Melbourne stars.

title.children: 'Bullying behaviour': Clarkson and Kangaroos ban Channel 7 pundit from interviews

image.altText: Jackson Irvine of the Socceroos, looking over his left shoulder during a soccer match

props.synopsis: Jackson Irvine has confirmed he will miss the Socceroos' final two World Cup qualifiers to undergo foot surgery.

title.children: Socceroos suffer injury blow ahead of crucial World Cup qualifiers

image.altText: a card that reads "with the compliments of HRH The Duchess of Sussex" on it

props.synopsis: The use of the title HRH on a card the duchess sent to a friend has set off British tabloids, but the royal couple say the haven't broken any agreements

title.children: Three letters on a card from the Duchess of Sussex sparks debate about her royal title

image.altText: Woman in glasses smiles.

props.synopsis: Prosecutors say a DV murderer, who used a 30cm kitchen knife to repeatedly stab his former partner, blames her for his actions in an apology letter read at his sentencing.

title.children: Murderer who stabbed ex-partner 78 times accused of 'victim blaming'

image.altText: Pauline Hanson having her selfie taken with a young man.

props.synopsis: In a last-minute campaign dash to the west, Pauline Hanson dropped in on the Nullarbor Muster to speak to voters days out from the federal election.

title.children: 'Forgotten' voters flock to Pauline Hanson amid Nullarbor visit

image.altText: Cash money in a purse with a calculator, tea towel, list of bills on a notepad and a pen

props.synopsis: Headline inflation has remained steady but the Reserve Bank's preferred measure of consumer prices has fallen within the RBA's target band for the first time in more than three years.

title.children: Headline inflation stable at 2.4pc while RBA's preferred measure drops within target

image.altText: Peter Dutton

props.synopsis: Looking back, the opposition leader might ruefully reflect that a savage aged care scare campaign might have come in handy right about now.

title.children: There's a reason Dutton can't resort to a scare campaign with older Australians

image.altText: Gruen Nation panellists Toby Raplh, Todd Sampson, Wil Anderson, Annie O'Rourke, Russel Howcroft and Hannah Ferguson.

props.synopsis: From corflutes on street corners to 'brain rot' memes on social media, political parties are pulling out all of the stops in an attempt to snag your vote this election. Gruen's panel of advertising brains break down the tricks from the (campaign) trail.

title.children: Gruen Nation unpacks the tricks of the trade from election ad campaigns

image.altText: shac teal

props.synopsis: The Climate 200 founder lit a fire that could clear a path for independents to decide the next government. They say his influence ends there.

title.children: Holmes à Court fuels movement that denies he will have seat at table

image.altText: Two soldiers walk down a path next to people taking photos on the banks of a river

props.synopsis: Pakistan said it has "credible intelligence" that India intends to launch military action soon, as tensions between the nuclear-armed neighbours escalate.

title.children: Pakistan says 'credible intelligence' points to Indian military action

image.altText: Two men sitting on chairs in a church

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has made big promises on Russia's war in Ukraine but he's becoming an impatient broker.

title.children: After meeting with Trump, Zelenskyy once again chose his words carefully

image.altText: An image of Qiong Yan, who has brown hair and a fringe.

props.synopsis: The man accused of murdering a woman, and keeping her body in a toolbox at his Brisbane apartment for almost a year, told police he was "tired of pretending" to be her, a Supreme Court trial has heard.

title.children: Murder accused told police he was 'tired of pretending' to be his alleged victim
